intro: Nicotiana commutata, commonly known as the Commutata tobacco plant, is a herbaceous species native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
